item.title: Was ‘IIT Baba’ ousted from Mahakumbh Mela ashram? Abhay Singh responds - Hindustan Times
item.description:
IIT Baba Denies Allegations Amid Controversy at Mahakumbh Mela

Publication Date: Jan 18, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Abhay Singh, popularly known as IIT Baba, responded to allegations regarding his departure from the Juna Akhara’s ashram, asserting that he was asked to leave rather than having ‘disappeared’ as reported.

  • Singh refuted claims from fellow seers about his mental health and drug use.
  • He stated that the ashram operators feared his newfound fame might expose them.
  • Singh emphasized his background as an aerospace engineering student from IIT Bombay.
  • He shared his journey from a successful career in Canada to spirituality.
“The operators of the Madi Ashram asked me to leave at night. They think I’ve become famous and might expose something about them.” - Abhay Singh

In conclusion, Abhay Singh’s journey reflects a complex intersection of spirituality and personal challenges, as he navigates fame and scrutiny at the Kumbh Mela.

item.title: Weather Update – IMD Warning Rain in Prayagraj Next 4 Days, Here Full Forecast - Times Bull
item.description:
Weather Update: IMD Warns of Rain in Prayagraj for the Next 4 Days

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: Times Bull

On Friday afternoon, most of Uttar Pradesh experienced sunny weather, providing some relief from the cold that has affected residents in recent days. The IMD predicts changing weather with rain expected from January 21-23, particularly peaking on the 22nd and 23rd.

  • Cold and chill persist, especially affecting Prayagraj and neighboring districts.
  • Weather patterns include dense fog and strong cold winds.
  • The temperature is predicted to drop by 2 degrees, with current maximum temperatures around 22.6 degrees Celsius.
  • Light rain is anticipated to occur in the coming days, particularly during the Maha Kumbh festival.
"महाकुंभ 2025 – भारत मौसम विज्ञान विभाग की ओर से जारी किया गया प्रयागराज क्षेत्र का मौसम पूर्वानुमान एवं चेतावनी।" — India Meteorological Department

Residents should prepare for continued cold conditions and remain aware of potential weather changes in the upcoming days.

item.title: Delhi Elections 2025: Kejriwal promises free water and electricity for tenants if AAP wins elections - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Delhi Elections 2025: Kejriwal promises free water and electricity for tenants if AAP wins elections

Date: January 18, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

In the lead-up to the highly anticipated Delhi assembly election in 2025, party leader Arvind Kejriwal stated on Saturday that tenants in Delhi who are deprived of free water and electricity will be covered by the program once the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) takes power.

  • The assembly election will see voting on February 5, with vote counting on February 8.
  • Kejriwal highlighted the issues faced by tenants, promising them access to free water and electricity.
  • Substantial benefits promised by AAP include ₹10 lakh auto insurance for drivers, free healthcare for the elderly, and ₹2,100 monthly honoraria for women.
  • Kejriwal stated, "Wherever I go, I meet people living on rent who say they benefit from good schools and hospitals but are deprived of free electricity and water schemes."
  • The AAP continues to push its welfare initiatives as its key campaign strategy as elections approach.
"We will ensure that after the elections, tenants, many of whom belong to the Purvanchal region, will also enjoy the benefits of free electricity and water."

The AAP aims to reinforce its position by providing significant benefits to residents, aligning its campaign with community needs and welfare.

item.title: Tenants in Delhi to get free electricity, water if AAP comes to power: Arvind Kejriwal - The Times of India
item.description:
Delhi Tenants to Receive Free Electricity and Water if AAP Wins Elections

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Chief Minister of Delhi, Arvind Kejriwal, announced that if the AAP party comes to power, tenants in Delhi will benefit from free electricity and water supplies, aiming to provide relief to the common people.

  • The proposal is part of AAP's broader electoral promises.
  • Kejriwal emphasized that this initiative aims to alleviate the financial burden on tenants.
  • The announcement was made during an election rally in Delhi.
“Our government will ensure that no tenant in Delhi has to pay for basic utilities like water and electricity,” said Kejriwal.

This initiative is a strategic move to gain support from the tenant community ahead of the upcoming elections, addressing key issues affecting daily life in the capital.

item.title: RG Kar rape case verdict live: Judgment today by Kolkata court, victim's kin say ‘more involved’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
RG Kar Rape Case Verdict Expected Today: Victim's Family Claims More Involved

Date: January 18, 2025, Source: Hindustan Times

The Kolkata court is set to deliver its first verdict today concerning the alleged rape and murder of a trainee doctor at RG Kar Medical College. This highly publicized case has resulted in nationwide protests and demands for justice.

  • The victim, a 31-year-old trainee doctor, was found dead in the seminar hall of RG Kar Medical College on August 9, 2024.
  • Sanjay Roy, a civic volunteer with the Kolkata Police, was arrested following the discovery of the victim's body, with evidence linking him to the crime.
  • The ongoing trial has sparked significant public outrage and demands for enhanced security in medical facilities.
  • The judgment will be announced by Judge Anirban Das, 57 days post the trial initiation, which included testimonies from 50 witnesses.
“I don't think only one person is involved in this case. Those who have committed financial misconduct in this case are definitely involved…” - Rekha Sharma, former NCW chief

Families of the victim express their belief that the investigation remains incomplete as they suspect others were involved in the crime. The outcome of today's verdict is awaited with hope for justice.

item.title: 'Mazak bana rakkha hai': Rahul Gandhi meets patients, families sleeping outside AIIMS Delhi, posts video - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rahul Gandhi Addresses Patients and Families Outside AIIMS Delhi

Date: Jan 18, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Rahul Gandhi of the Congress party met patients and families camping on the roads, footpaths, and subways around AIIMS Delhi, criticizing the central and state governments for their insensitivity.

  • Gandhi's visit coincided with the Delhi assembly elections.
  • He highlighted the struggles faced by patients forced to sleep outdoors amidst cold and lack of basic amenities.
  • Gandhi questioned the government's inaction amid what he described as a humanitarian crisis.
“Hell outside AIIMS! Poor patients and their families from across the country are forced to sleep outside AIIMS amidst the cold, filth, and hunger.” - Rahul Gandhi

Gandhi's statements reflect ongoing concerns regarding health access and governmental accountability, especially ahead of the elections.

item.title: 'Escaped death by 25 minutes': Sheikh Hasina on surviving ‘conspiracy to kill her’ in Bangladesh - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Escaped death by 25 minutes’: Sheikh Hasina on surviving ‘conspiracy to kill her’ in Bangladesh

Date: Jan 18, 2025 Source: HT News Desk

Former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has claimed there were several conspiracies to assassinate her throughout her life, highlighting her narrow escape from an alleged attempt last year. She emphasized that her survival is due to a will of Allah.

  • Hasina alleges multiple assassination attempts, with the latest occurring on August 5, 2024.
  • Over 600 casualties were reported during protests against her government.
  • She currently resides in India after fleeing her country due to the political crisis.
  • Hasina faces arrest warrants in Bangladesh related to crimes during her premiership.
“Surviving the killings on August 21, or surviving the huge bomb in Kotalipara, there must be a will of Allah.”

This situation highlights the ongoing political instability in Bangladesh and the contentious allegations against Hasina, now in exile.

item.title: 'We escaped death': Sheikh Hasina reveals assassination plot after ouster from Bangladesh - The Times of India
item.description:
Escaped death by 20 mins: Sheikh Hasina claims political opponents conspired to kill her

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Times of India

In a shocking revelation, Sheikh Hasina, the Prime Minister of Bangladesh, has stated that she narrowly escaped an assassination attempt orchestrated by her political opponents.

  • She claims she was only 20 minutes away from a fatal incident.
  • The Prime Minister pointed towards a conspiracy involving members of the opposition.
  • This allegation comes amidst rising tensions in Bangladesh's political landscape.
"I was informed about the plot to take my life, and it was only through sheer luck that I was not harmed." - Sheikh Hasina

This statement raises serious concerns about political stability and security in Bangladesh, necessitating immediate investigation into the alleged threats against the Prime Minister.

item.title: 'Escaped death by 20 mins': Sheikh Hasina claims political opponents conspired to kill her - The Times of India
item.description:
'Escaped death by 20 mins': Sheikh Hasina claims political opponents conspired to kill her

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

In a shocking claim, Bangladesh's Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina has stated that she narrowly escaped an assassination attempt orchestrated by her political opponents.

  • Hasina alleges a conspiracy by rivals to eliminate her politically.
  • She describes the critical moments leading up to her escape.
  • This incident adds tension to the already volatile political situation in Bangladesh.

'It was a matter of just 20 minutes that saved my life,' said Sheikh Hasina.

This revelation emphasizes the ongoing political unrest in the country and the lengths to which political rivalries can escalate.

item.title: ISRO carries out demonstration of restarting Vikas liquid engine - The Hindu
item.description:
ISRO Demonstrates Restarting of Vikas Liquid Engine

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) successfully demonstrated the ability to restart the Vikas liquid engine, marking a key milestone towards reusability in future launch vehicles.

  • The test occurred at the Propulsion Complex in Mahendragiri on January 17, 2025.
  • The engine was fired for 60 seconds, shut off for 120 seconds, then restarted and fired for an additional seven seconds.
  • This landmark test builds on a previous successful restart conducted in December 2024.
  • ISRO plans further tests to optimize engine performance under restart conditions.
  • The launch vehicle's core liquid stage was recently flagged off for a commercial mission aimed at launching the BlueBird Block 2 satellite.
“All engine parameters during the test were normal and as expected,” the ISRO stated.

This successful demonstration is a significant step towards enhancing the reusability of launch vehicles, promoting efficient space exploration efforts.

item.title: Maha Kumbh 2025: Prohibitory orders issued till Feb. 28 to maintain law and order - The Hindu
item.description:
Prohibitory Orders in Effect Until February 28 for Maha Kumbh 2025

Published on January 18, 2025 by The Hindu

A prohibitory order has been issued by the Additional Commissioner of Police in Prayagraj to ensure law and order during the Maha Kumbh Mela and other significant events occurring until February 28, 2025.

  • The order is in effect from January 16 to February 28, 2025.
  • It aims to prevent disruptions during various religious festivals and competitive examinations.
  • Concerns over anti-social elements causing disturbances led to the decision.
  • Events affected include Mahakumbh 2025, Republic Day, and several other religious observances.
"There is a possibility of anti-social elements causing disruption in law and order of the district. In view of the said festivals, there is an urgent need to maintain peace."

The imposition of these prohibitory orders is a measure to ensure that all planned events take place safely and without disruptions.

item.title: Saif Ali Khan stabbed: 48 hours gone, 30 Mumbai Police teams formed. Where is the attacker? - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Saif Ali Khan stabbed: 48 hours gone, 30 Mumbai Police teams formed. Where is the attacker?

Date: January 18, 2025
Source: HT News Desk

Over 48 hours after Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan was stabbed by an intruder at his Mumbai residence, police continue their search as Khan recovers at Lilavati Hospital.

  • Actor was attacked during a robbery attempt at his apartment in Bandra.
  • More than 30 police teams are actively working to find the assailant.
  • The attacker’s face was captured on CCTV, prompting a wide investigation.
  • Doctors report Khan is recovering well and may be discharged soon.
  • A carpenter was questioned, but later released; he was not connected to any crime gang.
“We are observing his progress, and he is doing excellently well according to our expectations.” - Dr. Nitin Dange

The incident has raised concerns about safety, but Khan's swift recovery provides a hopeful outlook for both him and his fans.

item.title: 8th Pay Commission Announced: Is Income Tax Relief Next? Experts Urge Budget 2025 Support for Middle Class - Times Now
item.description:
8th Pay Commission Announced: Is Income Tax Relief Next?

Publication Date: New Delhi

The announcement of the 8th Pay Commission has sparked discussions on the possibility of income tax relief for the middle class in the upcoming Budget 2025. This pay commission is expected to benefit over a crore central government employees and pensioners.

  • The government aims to produce consumption demand by enhancing wages through tax relief.
  • Experts believe income tax relief is essential to boost consumption and economic growth.
  • Political analyst Amitabh Tiwari emphasizes the need for immediate relief for individual taxpayers.
  • The 8th Pay Commission is expected to enhance consumption growth similar to measures taken during the 2008 global crisis.
  • The current tax structure is seen as unfavorable to the middle class, despite some increase in tax exemption limits.
“There needs to be immediate relief for individual taxpayers in the Budget to boost consumption and the economy.” - Amitabh Tiwari

In conclusion, the establishment of the 8th Pay Commission alongside potential tax relief for the middle class could foster economic growth by increasing consumption.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Delhi fog: Several trains, flights delayed; Rain, thunderstorm likely next week, says IMD - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Fog: 47 Trains, Several Flights Delayed; Rain, Thunderstorm Likely Next Week, Says IMD

Date: January 18, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi was affected by dense morning fog, impacting train and flight schedules with forecasted rain and thunderstorms in the coming days.

  • Delhi's minimum temperature is expected to be around 7°C, maximum around 19°C.
  • 47 trains were reported delayed due to foggy conditions.
  • Flights at IGI Airport faced delays as well.
  • Forecast predicts continuation of foggy conditions for three days, with rain or thunderstorms likely on January 22 and 23.
  • Improvement in air quality was noted after previous rainfall; AQI stood at 248.
“As per the air quality and weather forecast provided by IMD/IITM, there is a likelihood of AQI to remain in the lower end of the Very Poor category.”

This weather event highlights the challenges posed by winter fog in Delhi, impacting transportation and air quality, while residents await relief from anticipated rain.

item.title: The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 1 LIVE: Sunitha Krishnan welcomes RG Kar rape case, throws light on sex-trafficking - The Hindu
item.description:
The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 1 LIVE: ‘Sinauli excavations must answer Dalits’ role in Dravidian culture’, says Vasugi Bhaskar

Date Published: January 18, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The first day of The Hindu's Lit for Life 2025 featured deep discussions on the Dravidian culture, the role of Dalits, and the powerful effect of literature. Key speakers included prominent authors and cultural figures.

  • Dr. Abraham Verghese emphasized that a novel is the only instrument that can stop time.
  • Shashi Tharoor discussed the significance of words in shaping culture.
  • Vasugi Bhaskar highlighted the need for excavations to clarify Dalits' roles in Dravidian civilization.
  • Discussions included the merging of ideas in storytelling, as noted by filmmaker Rajiv Menon.
  • Sunitha Krishnan spoke on the societal impacts of sex trafficking.
“Dalits face issues of inversion and reversion, while trying to establish their history.” - Vasugi Bhaskar

The event showcased a diverse range of topics all centered on literature, culture, and societal issues, fostering valuable discourse among attendees.

item.title: The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 1 LIVE: While writing historical accounts, we should not bring in imagination, says A. Vennila - The Hindu
item.description:
The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 Day 1 LIVE: Netanyahu ‘hell-bent’ on not leaving Gaza

Date: January 18, 2025

Source: The Hindu

The Hindu Lit for Life 2025 kicked off with discussions led by notable figures such as Shashi Tharoor and International Affairs Editor Stanly Johny, who expressed critical views on the current state of Israel-Palestine relations.

  • Stanly Johny remarked on Netanyahu's determination regarding Gaza.
  • Discussion on the Biden administration's flawed approach to ceasefire efforts.
  • Renowned authors participate in various discussions throughout the event.
  • Key highlights include insights on the implications of political decisions on civilian rights.
“One state is controlling one geography with two political systems,” - Stanly Johny on apartheid allegations.

The event highlights significant discussions surrounding literature, politics, and their impact on society.
